titleStmt.title: By the Lords-Justices of Ireland. A proclamation. Charles Porter, Tho: Coningesby. Whereas we have received information that several persons besides the Lord-Mayor, recorder and the seneschals of the liberties of St. Sepulchers, Thomas-Court and Donore, have, contrary to our intentions, taken upon them to administer the oath of fidelity ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lords Justices and Council.
Coningsby, Thomas Coningsby, Earl, 1656?-1729.

titleStmt.title: By the Lords-Justices of Ireland. A proclamation. Charles Porter, Tho: Coningesby. Whereas we have received information that several persons besides the Lord-Mayor, recorder and the seneschals of the liberties of St. Sepulchers, Thomas-Court and Donore, have, contrary to our intentions, taken upon them to administer the oath of fidelity ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lords Justices and Council.
Coningsby, Thomas Coningsby, Earl, 1656?-1729.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook assignee of Benjamin Tooke printer to the King and Queen at Their Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and opening words of text.
"Given at the Council-Chamber in Dublin, the 29th day of December, 1690.".
Certificates not granted by the Lord Mayor, &c., of Dublin invalid.--Steele.
Steele notation: Arms 193. seve- Undue of.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
